comment.author: 9950064@N03
comment._content: I strongly suspect that this photograph is misidentified. The first Presbyterian Church of Buffalo, NY has a much different footprint, even in 1889 when the chapel was completed. This bears little if any resemblance to the present structure, unless drastic modifications were were made...I just don't see it. Please view the photographs from this group: www.flickr.com/groups/866379@N20/ and judge for yourself. Thanks, Bruce McCausland Historian, First Presbyterian Church, Buffalo, NY

comment.author: 30515687@N05
comment._content:
Thanks for helping us correct our identification! Since the original print was mislabeled, we'd love some help from you and other Buffalo residents to figure out what this photograph really depicts. Is it possible that it's some kind of an outbuilding for the church? or is it something else all together? We'd love to know.
Thanks!

comment.author: 9950064@N03
comment._content: I am not familiar with this view at all, nor have I seen it around Buffalo.  Clearly, the window is too narrow to be the chapel and the square base is too large and in the wrong position to be the base of the high tower. The porch is in the wrong position to be the edifice too.  I will try to investigate this.  If you have any additional photographs that are labeled to be our church, please upload them so that i can try to identify them for you..  I am looking for early photographs of the church, especially during construction.

comment.author: 9950064@N03
comment._content: This building is the Buffalo Crematorium Co. located at 901 Delavan Ave. (Near Delaware Ave.) in Buffalo, NY, across the street from the Forest Lawn Cemetery. See: www.flickr.com/photos/9950064@N03/3742238557/sizes/o/in/p...

comment.author: 30515687@N05
comment._content: Thank you so much for identifying the picture!
